page.title: 14Interview with Mr.Norton.
page.content: The Norton family have worked as bakers in Mattishall for a century. A hundred years ago all the dough was mixed by hand and baked in ovens heated by coal fires. The ovens then were much bigger:half the size of the whole of the present bakery! Now they make cakes as well as bread but in the old days people used to make their own cakes and bring them to the bakery to be cooked in the ovens. Much more brown bread is eaten now than it used to be:twenty years ago it was only one loaf in ten,now about four loaves in ten are brown. The bakery has about one thousand customers per week:between 150 and 200 per day.The shop is open for six hours per day,but Mr.Norton starts work at 05.00 and finishes at 18.00 when the shop closes.Most of his recipes are secret,many are old-fashioned.
